column4: Ive used ubuntu on this machine for a while... recently I had to wipe my drive. Reinstalled an old version of ubuntu then upgraded to most recent. For some reason it compiz will suddenly disapear and shortly after the computer will logg off completely and Ill have to type my pw again.
this started AFTER installing custom desktop effects (spinning cube etc) but still continues after uninstalling
Ill mail a chocolate chip cookie to anyone tht can help me!
what does "old version" mean?
intrepid
you upgraded intrepid -> jaunty -> karmic?
nope, followed the website for a direct upgrade to karmic... update-manager --dev version or whatever
wait
not karmic... whatever 10.04 is :P
erm, whatever website you followed advised you incorrectly.  You may have a broken install.  Why don't you just install karmic fresh?
ubuntu.com was the website :P
I guarantee you it did not tell you to upgrade directly from intrepid to lucid
it did
link?
only site i trust
just a sec
might reboot again as i search
meh its freezing.. but thats where it said. Doesn't matter. I cant install the new one fresh because it breaks wireless
and I don't have a wired connection (tis in roommates room and dont want to sit in her room while I try to fix it)
I am telling you it did not say that because that it isn't supported.  Anyway install 10.04 correctly if you want and then head over to #ubuntu+1 for support as it's still not released yet
easier question, how do I switch to metacity then back to compiz?
